abstract: Wells Fargo‘s chairman, Richard M. Kovacevich, didn’t want to take the federal government’s bailout money in the first place. Now, he is assailing the government for imposing new restrictions on financial institutions that receive federal money, and he calls a federal plan to subject big banks to stress tests “asinine.”
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo‘s chairman, Richard M. Kovacevich, didn’t want to take the federal government’s bailout money in the first place. Now, he is assailing the government for imposing new restrictions on financial institutions that receive federal money, and he calls a federal plan to subject big banks to stress tests “asinine.”

headline.main: Wells Fargo Chairman Assails Tighter TARP Rules
